rules.passwordLength: Password must be at least 8 characters long
rules.passwordUppercase: Password must contain at least one uppercase letter
rules.passwordLowercase: Password must contain at least one lowercase letter
rules.passwordNumberContain: Password must contain at least one number
rules.passwordSpecialContain: Password must contain at least one special character

search.searchPlayholder: Enter public address, transaction hash, or crypto token

fearAndGreed.title: Fear and Greed Index
fearAndGreed.about: About CMC Crypto Fear and Greed Index
fearAndGreed.description: The CMC Fear and Greed Index is a proprietary tool developed by CoinMarketCap that measures the prevailing sentiment in the cryptocurrency market. This index ranges from 0 to 100, where a lower value indicates extreme fear, and a higher value indicates extreme greed. It helps investors understand the emotional state of the market, which can influence buying and selling behaviors. The index provides insights into whether the market may be undervalued (extreme fear) or overvalued (extreme greed).

section.howToUseThisIndex: How can I use this index?

marketSentimentAnalysis.title: Market Sentiment Analysis
marketSentimentAnalysis.content: By observing the current value of the index, you can gauge the overall mood of the cryptocurrency market. For example, a high value suggests that investors are overly greedy, which may indicate that the market is overheated and due for a correction. Conversely, a low value may suggest that fear is driving prices down, potentially creating buying opportunities.

contrarianStrategy.title: Contrarian Strategy
contrarianStrategy.content: Some investors use the index as part of a contrarian investment strategy. The idea is to be fearful when others are greedy and greedy when others are fearful. If the index shows extreme greed, it might be a signal to consider selling assets, while extreme fear could indicate a buying opportunity.

complementaryAnalysis.title: Complementary Analysis
complementaryAnalysis.content: Use the index alongside other analytical tools and indicators to make more informed decisions. It’s important to remember that the index is a tool for gauging sentiment and should not be used in isolation.

priceMomentum.title: Price Momentum
priceMomentum.content: This factor analyzes the price performance of the top 10 cryptocurrencies by market capitalization (excluding stablecoins). It assesses how these coins are performing relative to each other and the broader market.

volatility.title: Volatility
volatility.content: The index incorporates Volmex Implied Volatility Indices (BVIV and EVIV) for Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH), which provide forward-looking measures of expected volatility over the next 30 days.

derivativesMarket.title: Derivatives Market
derivativesMarket.content: The index considers the Put/Call Ratio in the Bitcoin and Ethereum options markets. A higher ratio of puts to calls indicates more fear in the market, suggesting bearish expectations among investors.

marketComposition.title: Market Composition
marketComposition.content: This component looks at the relative value of Bitcoin (BTC) in the market, using the Stablecoin Supply Ratio (SSR) to measure the ratio between Bitcoin’s market capitalization and that of major stablecoins.

CMCProprietaryData.title: CMC (coin market cap) Proprietary Data
CMCProprietaryData.content: The index also uses social trend keyword searches and user engagement metrics to capture market sentiment, retail interest, and emerging trends.

fearAndGreed.dataSource: Data source: CoinMarketCap Fear & Greed Index
